metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15680 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
TightVNC code version 1.3.10 contains null pointer dereference in HandleZlibBPP function, which results Denial of System (DoS). This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. Pavel Cheremushkin discovered that TightVNC has a null pointer dereference vulnerability. An attacker could use it to cause a Denial of Service or possible a remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tightvncserver - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
xtightvncviewer - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, this is a non-issue in libvncserver as checks are already done in zlib, see: https://github.com/LibVNC/libvncserver/issues/359#issuecomment-599133529 for completeness, the fix was added to focal and earlier releases, but will not be added to groovy+

criterions.comment: libvncserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ssvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
tightvnc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1').
vncsnapshot: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
x11vnc package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
